info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 07 at 3:09PM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...Patchy Freezing Drizzle Over the Adirondacks Thursday Morning... Patchy freezing drizzle may create localized icy conditions across the Northern Adirondacks early Thursday morning, mainly at elevations above 1000 ft. Elevated surfaces and bridges will be the most susceptible to light ice accumulations, but no more than a trace of ice is expected overall. The main window for slick conditions will be between 3 AM and 9 AM on Thursday. After 9 AM, freezing drizzle will come to an end. Precautionary/Preparedness Actions... The freezing drizzle may quickly coat roadways with a thin layer of ice that may be undetectable. Please use extreme caution...especially on bridges...overpasses and around curves. Allow plenty of stopping distance and avoid braking suddenly.
